page.title: 01THE LAND AROUND THE DEE
page.content: On the left bank of the Dee the land is dividedd into small farms (mainly sheep and cattle), joined by narrow roads. Senwick House, a country hotel, sits beside one of these roads. The land consists of gentle hills with small rocky outcrops and woodland. The Dhoon Bay is a popular bathing resort and nearby is the recent Millhall Housing Estate. The tidal river, though seemingly wide, has a very narrow channel, marked by buoys and used now only by the fishing fleet from nearby Kirkcudbright and occasional pleasure-craft. The point of St. Marys Isle, a private estate, is wooded, rocky and uninhabited. On the opposite bank is a young deciduous wood and arable farmland. On the shore is the Kirkcudbright Lifeboat Station, manned by a part-time volunteer crew.
